column5: We will be heading north of Kenora on May 24th and looking for a bait dealer that has discounts on large orders. Looking to buy 80 dozen minnows that we can't get at the resort so would like to find someone along the way that can handle the order. Does anybody have a recommendations?
We are also heading north of Kenora on the 24th. We are stopping at Bite me Bait shop in Nestor Falls for crawlers. I don't know what thier minnow situation is.
Just wondering if you got my email with regards to the minnows?
X2, order my leeches and nightcrawlers from them 2 weeks ahead of arrival, stop in, buy license, snacks and anything else to make the trip up 502 more enjoyable......on the road again!!

Holy cats 80 dz??? How are you going to transport 80 dz and keep them from going belly up in a day or 2. You might consider salted or packaged and add leeches and crawlers. The walleye like them too and are significantly easier to keep.

Hey Jahloaf, I have friends who own Sunset Baits located on the Trans-Canada Highway when you enter Kenora on the east side on your way from Fort Frances. I have talked to him about your situation and he will be able to fill your order. PM me and I will forward you all the detailed information that he gave me.
Call these two Bait Stores in Kenora or Keewatin 1. Sunset Baits 17 E Hwy 17 Kenora 807-468-9567 2. Bounty Baits 18 Mc Kenzie Portage Rd Keewatin807-543-2664

Hi--we bring a pair of 'bait tamers' and have very low minnow mortality, as long as the water temps. are fairly cool. We bring large quantities of minnows every year, and experience very little die off.
